intro: Leontice darwasica, commonly known as the Darwasica leontice, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
